description: A television special that is set after the second season and centers around Ryuusui Nanami.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Economics
tags.description: Centers around the field of economics.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Aviation
tags.description: Regarding the flying or operation of aircraft.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Cosplay
tags.description: Features dressing up as a different character or profession.

tags.name: Astronomy
tags.description: Relating or centered around the study of celestial objects and phenomena, space, or the universe.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description:
__Current residence:__ Tokyo, Japan

 [Twitter](https://x.com/Boichi_Bo1) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@boichibetoon) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/boichibetoon/)

Intended to be a manga artist from his childhood days, Mujiki Park aka Boichi majored college in physics as preparation to draw science fiction works and also to learn the technology of performance and imaging. He went on to graduate school to major in image technology.
In 1993, while still enrolled, he debuted in a Korean shoujo manga magazine. Since then, he is gaining popularity releasing a number of works, and publishing books on how to draw manga targeting a wide range of reader. He also published books focusing on the art of manga as well as the use of computer assisted tools.

He rejoins Japan in 2004 and steps into the world of Japanese manga with Space Chef Caisar published in the monthly Comic Gum. Since then he published many manga and one-shots.

In 2005, he publishes Lovers in Winter. A compilation of 9 out of his 11 hentai oneshots serialized in the adult magazine Comic Aun.

In 2006, he publishes 2 scifi oneshots: Hotel (Lucca 2011’s award for Best Oneshot) and Present, both in the magazine Morning. Along with All for the Tuna, Stephanos and Diadem, they’ll be compiled in 2008 in the Hotel tankoubon.

Sun-Ken Rock was in 2006 his first long serialization, becoming his flagship series until its completion in 2016. It was published in the bi-weekly magazine Young King by Shonen Gahosha. Several spin-off were also published in Young King such as one focusing on Yumin in 2011 or Pickaxe in 2012. A third one titled Feed Yumin was published monthly in 2012 in the Monthly Young King of Shonen Gahosha.

Boichi was also the artist of Raqiya written by YAJIMA Masao and published chez Kodansha from 2008 to 2010 as well as for the Terra Formars Asimov spin-off of 2016 published by Shueisha. Similarly, he was the artist of the oneshots Brutality by Takeda Yuusuke in 2007 and eques by Kengo Miyatani i 2012.

Boichi is also an accomplished humanitarian. As to express his sentiment toward Vietnam and apologize for Korea’s action during the war, Sun-Ken Rock volume 2’s royalties were donated to the NPO Children of Vietnam. Among other actions, he also initiated actions such as Korean mangakas drawing a support page for Japan’s 2011 March 11th Tōhoku earthquake by giving the royalties to the Red Cross. It’s also with the will to help the reconstruction of Japan following this traumatic event that he begins at the end of 2011 up till 2013 the publication of H.E the Hunt for Energy in Shueisha’s Jump X magazine.

He never fails to show his support to the Freedom of Speech and liberty as he did for the events of Paris Terror Attacks or during the Refugee Crisis.

Boichi’s manga are firstly published in Japanese but some are also available in a variety of languages such as French, Italian, German, Spanish, Thai, English, Korean and Chinese, showing the always growing interest of the world in his work.

He won the 7th "Story King" section in Weekly Shonen Jump No.51 2001. His previous works include Any number of times on the 13th of June, Square Freeze and LOVE LOVE Santa, which were published in Big Comic Spirits. He is married to the stage and voice actress [Orie Kimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95940/Orie-Kimoto).
[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuichirokido/)
[Twitter](https://x.com/doremifaeiga)
[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuichirokido/)
Originating from [Tezuka Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/200/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Horidesk) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/horidesk/) | [Website](http://horidesk.m78.com)

Originating from Studio Pokke, currently freelance.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉原俊一郎)

Affiliated with studio Bihou.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/txa2xt2a)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mocchi_0422)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

__[Profile (Exhibition of Music)](https://www.yukikanesaka-woh.tokyo/about)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yukikanesaka)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kanesaka.yuki)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yukikanesaka)__

__Residency:__ Boston, Massachusetts
__Graduated:__ Ichihara Chuo High School, Seiwa University, Berklee College of Music

__Yukihiro Kanesaka__ is a Japanese musician, multi instrumentalist, producer, DJ, beat maker, assistant professor, composer and member of hip-hip group [Hybrid Thoughts](https://anilist.co/staff/162625).

 He goes by the alias Yuki Kanesaka when producing, monolog as a multi instrumentalist, and DJ U-KEY when beatmaking, additionally he works as an assistant professor at Berklee College of Music.

__Graduated:__ Tokyo College of Music

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cut_tatsu7) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tatsuya__kato/)
[Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/hiroakitsutsumi) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiroaki850605)

name.native: バーンアウトシンドロームズ

node.description:
__[Website](http://burnoutsyndromes.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/burnout_live) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCXos4VWtLz_TNjLZy6F8mdw)__

__Introduction:__
BURNOUT SYNDROMES is a Japanese three-piece rock band under record label EPIC Records Japan (2016–), affiliated with the entertainment agency Handmade Music. 

__Biography:__
The band initially formed in 2005, due to Taiyu being heavily influenced by his brother to start a band. He would first invite Kazuumi, who went to the same school as Taiyu, then he invited Takuya, who was an avid player of drum mania at the local game center. This trio would eventually become the BURNOUT SYNDROMES as we know today.

__Members:__
- [Kazuumi Kumagai](https://anilist.co/staff/149247) (熊谷和海) – vocalist, guitarist, in-charge of lyrics and composition
- Taiyu Ishikawa (石川大裕) – bassist, chorus, M&C
- Takuya Hirose (廣瀬拓哉) – drummer, chorus

__Nickname:__ Kuma-san (くまさん) __Favorite Artists:__ [BUMP OF CHICKEN](https://anilist.co/staff/109225/Bump-Of-Chicken), [ASIAN KUNG-FU GENERATION](https://anilist.co/staff/100251/Asian-KungFu-Generation) __Favorite Song:__ [Kyou made Soshite Ashita kara](https://anidb.net/song/54538) from [Crayon Shin-chan: Arashi o Yobu Mouretsu! Otona Teikoku Gyakushuu](https://anilist.co/anime/2450/Crayon-Shinchan-Movie-09-Arashi-wo-Yobu-Mouretsu-Otona-Teikoku-no-Gyakushuu/), released in 2001. __ Favorite Color:__ Red __Favorite Hobbies:__ Manga, Games __Introduction:__ Kazuumi Kumagai is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger, guitarist and member of the band Burnout Syndromes. __Biography:__ When he was in the first year of junior high school, he was invited to play in a band. He accepted the offer and started listening to music, writing lyrics and composing music. After joining the band he was told to play the guitar by band member [Ishikawa Taiyu](https://twitter.com/BURNOUTSYNDROME), which led him take on the guitar and be in charge of vocals in the band. On May 4, 2005 the pair Kazuumi and Taiyu decided they needed another member, so Taiyu invited [Hirose Takuya](https://twitter.com/hirose_burnout) to be the final member of the line-up for the rock-band BURNOUT SYNDROMES. Hirose at the time had been immersed at the local game center playing "DrumMania", so he saw this as an opportunity and accepted the offer from Taiyu. After this they proceeded to officially form the band on the same date. In 2010, they temporarily suspended band activities to focus on taking exams. Kazuumi alongside Taiyu and Takuya made their initial major debut as BURNOUT SYNDROMES with the song "[FLY HIGH!!](https://anidb.net/song/84120)", which was used as the second opening theme to the [Mitsunaka Susumu](https://anilist.co/staff/113823/Susumu-Mitsunaka) directed second season of the anime _[Haikyuu!!](https://anilist.co/anime/20992/Haikyuu-2/) 2_, otherwise known as _HAIKYU!! 2nd Season_. __Trivia:__ - He can't see his face because of his bangs. - Mentions that he usually sleeps during holidays (Source: [Wikipedia (Kazuumi Kumagai)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%86%8A%E8%B0%B7%E5%92%8C%E6%B5%B7), edited | [Wikipedia (BURNOUT SYNDROMES)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/BURNOUT_SYNDROMES), edited)

__Nickname:__ Kuma-san (くまさん) __Favorite Artists:__ [BUMP OF CHICKEN](https://anilist.co/staff/109225/Bump-Of-Chicken), [ASIAN KUNG-FU GENERATION](https://anilist.co/staff/100251/Asian-KungFu-Generation) __Favorite Song:__ [Kyou made Soshite Ashita kara](https://anidb.net/song/54538) from [Crayon Shin-chan: Arashi o Yobu Mouretsu! Otona Teikoku Gyakushuu](https://anilist.co/anime/2450/Crayon-Shinchan-Movie-09-Arashi-wo-Yobu-Mouretsu-Otona-Teikoku-no-Gyakushuu/), released in 2001. __ Favorite Color:__ Red __Favorite Hobbies:__ Manga, Games __Introduction:__ Kazuumi Kumagai is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger, guitarist and member of the band Burnout Syndromes. __Biography:__ When he was in the first year of junior high school, he was invited to play in a band. He accepted the offer and started listening to music, writing lyrics and composing music. __Yuuki Kishida__ is a Japanese composer, arranger, pianist and keyboardist affiliated with Kick Up Studio.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yukikishida) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuki_kishida) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7MhWrfW2HH8_umBaVNbUGw)__

__Yuuki Kishida__ is a Japanese composer, arranger, pianist and keyboardist affiliated with Kick Up Studio.
